item.title: ChatGPT vs Perplexity — AI Assistant or AI Search Engine?
item.description:
ChatGPT vs Perplexity: The Quick Answer

ChatGPT is a general-purpose AI assistant — writing, coding, brainstorming, image generation. Perplexity is an AI-powered search engine — research, fact-finding, and sourced answers. They’re not really competitors. They solve different problems. Most power users have both.

Research

Winner: Perplexity (by a lot)

This is Perplexity’s whole thing, and it’s excellent at it. Every answer comes with cited sources. You can see exactly where the information came from and click through to verify. The follow-up questions drill deeper into topics naturally.

item.title: Claude vs Gemini — Quality vs Context Window
item.description:
Claude vs Gemini: The Quick Answer

Claude produces better output — cleaner writing, stronger reasoning, more reliable code. Gemini has the biggest context window in the game (1M+ tokens) and deep Google integration. Claude wins on quality. Gemini wins on volume. For most solo builders, quality matters more.

Writing Quality

Winner: Claude

Claude writes with a clarity and directness that Gemini can’t match. The prose is tighter, the tone is more natural, and the first draft needs less editing.

item.title: ChatGPT (OpenAI)
item.description:
What is ChatGPT?

OpenAI’s flagship consumer AI product. GPT-4o is the engine — a multimodal model that handles text, images, audio, and code. The app layers on web browsing, DALL-E image generation, file analysis, and a plugin ecosystem. It’s the most feature-complete AI assistant available.

Who is it for?

  • Best for: Solo builders who want a single AI tool for everything — writing, research, coding, images
  • Not for: People who need the absolute best quality in one domain (Claude beats it for writing, Midjourney for images)
  • Solo builder score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5)

What does it cost?

Plan Price What You Get
Free $0 GPT-4o (limited), GPT-4o-mini, DALL-E, browsing
Plus $20/mo More GPT-4o, voice mode, early features
Pro $200/mo Unlimited GPT-4o, o1-pro for heavy reasoning
API Pay-per-token GPT-4o ~$2.50/M input

Hidden costs: The $200/mo Pro tier exists and OpenAI keeps pushing features there first. Plus is fine for most people.

item.title: Claude (Anthropic)
item.description:
What is Claude?

Claude is Anthropic’s family of AI models. Opus is the powerhouse for deep reasoning, Sonnet is the daily driver balancing speed and quality, and Haiku is the fast/cheap option for simple tasks. For solo builders, you’ll live in Sonnet 90% of the time and pull out Opus when you need to think hard.

Who is it for?

  • Best for: Solo builders who need high-quality writing, complex coding help, or deep analysis
  • Not for: People who just need quick factual lookups (Perplexity is better) or image generation
  • Solo builder score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)

What does it cost?

Plan Price What You Get
Free $0 Limited Sonnet messages, basic features
Pro $20/mo More Sonnet, some Opus, Projects, longer context
API Pay-per-token Sonnet ~$3/M input, Opus ~$15/M input

Hidden costs: Pro usage caps aren’t published — you’ll hit them during heavy work sessions. API is more predictable but requires technical setup.

item.title: Claude vs ChatGPT — Which AI Should Solo Builders Use in 2026?
item.description:
Claude vs ChatGPT: The Quick Answer

Claude wins on writing quality and coding. ChatGPT wins on versatility (images, browsing, plugins). If you write or code a lot, Claude. If you want one tool for everything, ChatGPT. Most serious builders end up paying for both.

Writing Quality

Winner: Claude

Claude writes like a human who happens to be very smart. ChatGPT writes like an AI that’s been trained to sound helpful. The difference shows up in long-form content, nuanced arguments, and anything that needs a real voice.

item.title: Gemini (Google)
item.description:
What is Gemini?

Google’s AI platform, powered by the Gemini model family. The killer feature is context — 1M+ tokens means you can feed it entire books, codebases, or research papers. Comes with built-in Google Search, image generation (Imagen), and tight integration with Google Workspace.

Who is it for?

  • Best for: Researchers, content creators processing large documents, anyone in Google’s ecosystem
  • Not for: People who need the best writing quality (Claude) or the most versatile tool (ChatGPT)
  • Solo builder score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5)

What does it cost?

Plan Price What You Get
Free $0 Gemini Pro, image gen, web search, generous limits
Advanced $20/mo 1M+ context, Workspace integration, Gemini Ultra
API Pay-per-token Pro: free tier available, Ultra from ~$1.25/M input

Hidden costs: The $20/mo bundles with Google One (2TB storage), which is actually decent value if you need cloud storage anyway.
